Description: Rim and body sherd of North Ionian black-figured pottery krater with handle root; interior glazed streaky black band at rim, reserved below; top of rim black with one added white rosette and one white 'chevron tree' preserved; edge of rim black in handle zone, black bars on rest; band fired red at junction with shoulder; on shoulder, black-figure decoration consisting of animal (ear, red neck, and part of white shoulder remaining of bull or boar) to left.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd is published as a dinos but since it has a handle, that is impossible (CVA Cambridge II).
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 39, pl. XX, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1021)
